column1: 11|Senior Security Partner
Information Security
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 167 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series
column2: documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want
column5: on any internet-connected screen. Members can play
column7: all without commercials or commitments. With our growing investment in original content Netflix Studio is a key part of our mission to produce content to entertain a diverse global audience.

column1: The Team

The Studio Information Security team is the primary group focused on providing a balanced approach to securing our environment as Netflix builds a world class studio. We are a multi-functional and highly adaptive team
column2: who bring their unique skills to tackle a variety of unique security challenges. Securing our new studio and production ecosystems
column3: protecting our key content from attacks and leaks
column4: and engaging with high profile productions are just a small example of the wide range of security topics we engage in.

column1: The Opportunity

This role will be the key security point of contact for our Studio leadership and stakeholders. You will be building relationships with our studio organizations to develop a deep understanding of the line of business
column2: their key security objectives and to drive an informed security context into their teams. This role will also provide guidance back to our Information Security team to enable them to develop solutions that can align well with the business. You will be a champion of reducing risk within their line of business through sound security principles and guidance. Establishing channels of high quality transparency and communications with the Studio stakeholders will be instrumental to succeed as they will look to you for direction and guidance for all security matters.

column1: Netflix has a unique and innovative culture that guides us to do things differently. This helps keep velocity high
column2: but also means that our security team needs to operate differently than a traditional security team. The two important aspects of the culture that affect how we operate are “Freedom and Responsibility” and “Context not Control”. Employees have tremendous freedom in their work
column3: along with the corresponding responsibility to do the right thing for Netflix. Instead of controlling our studio stakeholders with process and security gates
column4: we enable them to securely create great content by providing security context to make the right decisions for Netflix.

Job Purpose:

Information Security Data Specialist will play a leading role in driving information security analysis and strategy within the Security State Management team. This position reports to the head of Security State Management. Information Security is a primary area of focus for Citi. The Security State Manage Team partners with Citi organizations to provide world class Information Security support. This key position reports into the Security State Management organization and will be at the heart of managing vulnerabilities and threats affecting technology infrastructure.

Develop and manage program metrics and performance through tracking/reporting and active engagement with stakeholders for continuous service improvement.

column1: Posted Job Title
IT Director
Job Profile Title
Information Technology Director
Job Description Summary
Reporting to the University Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) and working in close collaboration with the CISO and the other Directors in the organization
column2: the IT Director is charged with helping to develop and lead in implementing information security strategy and tools within the ISC Office of Information Security.

column1: Job Description

The individual is responsible for: providing leadership as well as overseeing day-to-day operations and activities related to the creation and delivery of security projects to the University; planning and managing complex multi-year projects and associated initiatives designed to improve the University’s overall information security program; facilitating campus-wide working groups point of contact to diverse University community in support of these effort; supporting the CISO in the delivery of his/her duties when needed; maintaining knowledge of changing information security threats
column3: best practices and regulations; developing and implement methods for supporting
column4: measuring and reporting on University compliance with relevant legal and policy requirements; reviewing and updating internal policies
column5: procedures and guidance to ensure continued relevance and applicability; and coaching and direct more junior staff.

column1: Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or other related field and a minimum of seven years of information security work or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Demonstrated experience with project management
column3: conducting and overseeing efforts associated with multiple
column4: simultaneous initiatives. The ability to plan
column6: organization-wide program over the longer term. Demonstrated ability to motivate autonomous organizational units to make security improvements and the ability to work in environments where information security does not operate with heavy handed mandates. Experience supervising and coaching. Experience presenting to and working with executives and/or faculty preferred. column1: 174|Security Technology Manager|"About the Security Technology Manager position.
The Security Technology Manager is responsible for the oversight
column3: and ongoing management of the physical security technology of the Jewish Federation of Cleveland. The Manager will provide project management
column4: coordination of team members and third-party vendors
column11: and documentation of the security technology. The Manager will work directly with the Federation Security team to manage projects and issue resolution to completion. The position reports to Director
column12: IT Operations. Preferred candidates are excellent communicators and problem-solvers
column15: and have experience implementing and managing complex technology projects and systems.

column1: Essential Functions:
Physical Security and Surveillance Systems Management
Maintain a strong understanding of all parts of the Federation’s security technology
column2: and those of its beneficiary agencies.

column1: Lead the implementation of new security technology including cameras
Work closely with internal IT staff and third-party vendors to ensure successful deployment of the security technology.
Manage third-party vendors during the implementation and maintenance of systems
column2: holding them accountable to agreed upon timelines and specifications.

column1: Respond to and escalate security system issues with third-party vendors or internal IT staff
Work with third-party vendors or internal IT staff to ensure security technology remains patched
Project Management
Manage project phases
column3: facilitate decisions and follow through on the execution of projects.

column1: Provide project management during all phases of security project lifecycle including creation of end to end project plans.
Create and maintain documentation for all relevant systems and changes.
Develop RFPs and RFQs for security technology projects.
Foster relationship with agency IT and identify opportunities for improved purchasing power.
Assist with management of non-security Federation projects as needed.
Research
Stay current on latest security technology and trends and make recommendations for potential use at the Federation and beneficiary agencies.
Act as an advisor to assess short and long-term security technology needs as well as vendor recommendations for Federation and beneficiary agencies.
Required Qualifications:
5+ years of experience managing or implementing complex technology or security systems.
Demonstrated project management experience and understanding of project management tools and methodologies.
Experience implementing or managing security technology systems including access control
Understanding of TCP/IP networking including switching
Understanding of Windows networking and latest Windows Server environments.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Genetec Security Center.
Experience with hosted/cloud infrastructure solutions.
Understanding of information security best practices.
